revised_title: Hyperasymptotics for Integrals with Finite Endpoints: A New Approach to Asymptotic Analysis
tldr: The author develops a new method called hyperasymptotics to study integrals with finite endpoints. This method improves the accuracy of the asymptotic expansions by incorporating the global saddle structure of the integrand. The author applies this method to the complementary error function and an incomplete Airy function, demonstrating its effectiveness in analyzing integrals with complex parameters.
